II. Purpose of Addendum
Wolverine Human Services Aftercare has applied for authorization to evaluate
applicants for adoption and to place and supervise children with adoptive parents.
III. Methodology
11/13/2008- Onsite inspection. Reviewed and approved agency’s policies and
procedures for adoption evaluation services and adoption placement services.
11/17/2008- Received a Child Placing Agency Application requesting to add
authorization of adoption evaluation services and adoption placement services.
11/17/2008- Addendum to Original Licensing Study completed. Authorization for
adoption evaluation services and placement services approved.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
Wolverine Human Services Aftercare is an established Child Placing Agency. The
agency has a regular license and has a contract with the Department of Human
Services (DHS). The agency has been authorized to certify foster homes for
licensure; to receive children for placement in licensed foster homes; and to
supervise independent living placements. The license is effective November 30,
2007- November 29, 2009.
On November 17, 2008, the agency applied to add authorization of adoption
evaluation services and adoption placement services. The policies and procedures
were reviewed and approved. The Chief Administrator states that DHS will contract
for the services as part of a continuum of foster care services.
V. Recommendation
It is recommended that Wolverine Human Services Aftercare be approved to provide
adoption evaluation services and adoption placement services.
